Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Julimd
Reviews.Content: I got this room at part of a package deal. I read all of the reviews prior. I was pleasantly surprised. It's a quant little place, which seemed very secure. I liked how it was isolated, with only one entrance & exit by the from office. The neighborhood wasn't "bad." Yes, I saw a strip club on the other side of a major street. The parking lot of the club was virtually empty & I never saw anyone go in or out, nor did I hear a sound in 3 nights. This is in part because the club is not visible from the motel rooms or pool at all. People really make a bigger deal out of it than it is. The staff was nice. The continental breakfast was fine. Yes, it was just pastries, which is what continental generally means. I realize a lot of chain hotels offer full breakfasts now. That's not what this place is. IHOP is right there if you want eggs! The pool area was cute. One night the hot tub wasn't working well, but they fixed it while we were there & it was great after that. It's not a luxury resort. It's a perfectly fine place to sleep if you're more interested in spending time out and about and aren't ultra picky about accommodations. It's minutes from beaches, the bay, and major attractions. I personally like the convince of being close to fast food & Target, so it's not necessary to pay tourist prices for sun screen & snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Windy2409
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on many things, however we didn't know that it was across the street from a strip club. The place seemed very sketchy, the whole time we were there which was a lot because we had bad weather, it didn't seem like a very safe or secure place. During one of our 3 night stay people were talking outside our door and the staff didn't do anything about it, however the staff was friendly. The room itself had had patches of wall paper that looked like it had been cut out and then just put right back in the same place where you could clearly see where it had been removed. The socks to plug in lights didnt cove the whole circle of a hole there was, the blow drier was jim riged to the light socket. I thought, plugging in my own stuff was going to catch the place on fire. Anytime someone in another room was flushing the toilet or showering it was as if they were doing it in your room. We had our daughter with us and so I brought bed sheets just incase and I'm glad I did. The bath towels weren't very soft, but when we asked for more we got more. The hot water took awhile to get hot, it was a warmish feel and with bad weather I wanted a hot shower. Overall, our experience was not the most pleasant. The breakfast that is included looked home made and it was coffee and some biscuit thing (didn't try it) IHOP was next door so we went there. We would never stay her again or recommend this motel to anyone else. We weren't under the impression that this was a motel, and in dire need of updates/remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On.”
Reviews.Author: pandaeatworld
Reviews.Content: This isn't a high-end hotel, it's not a fancy place, but the staff are friendly and helpful and the room is comfy and pleasant enough to get 5stars in it's bracket.

Reviews.Title: “CONFIRM what you are expecting to get.”
Reviews.Author: Don R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are both from San Diego, so we knew the location beforehand, as well as the proximity to the airport and the noisy jets taking off. Nice clean room, and quiet, even though we were right next to the noisy elevator. Comfortable beds. Nice clean pool and jacuzzi. This is a no-frills place, with a minimal continental breakfast, but we did our research and knew this coming in. Reading some reviews, I don't understand how people are surprised by what they find after checking in. You need to do your research. That being said, overall we were only basically satisfied. We had reserved a KING room, and had the confirmation to prove it, but when we arrived we were given a 2 QUEEN room. They said we had been "upgraded" from "a smaller room with only 1 bed to a bigger room with 2 beds" that normally costs $10 more. We sleep in a queen bed at home, and wanted a king, which is why we reserved one. The lady acted like she was doing us a favor by giving us 2 beds instead of 1. Whatever. Now on to the free wi-fi. One of the main reasons we chose this hotel over 2 or 3 others near the same area and in the same price range was the free in-room wi-fi. The connection, when working, was strong and fast. When working. When it was up, it would stay connected anywhere from 1-15 minutes before dropping. It would take at least 5-10 minutes before it would come back up. Again for only 1-15 minutes. The longest it stayed connected was about 40 minutes around midnight the first night (Saturday). Sunday it was spotty until around 2PM, then it went down again until the next morning at around 9AM, 2 hours before checkout. The front desk said that yes, they were having problems with it, and had to keep resetting it, and that someone was coming in on Monday to take a look at it. Great. We were there for Saturday and Sunday. They told me that there was an internet cafe within walking distance, and a Kinkos about 3 blocks away. I had work I needed to do online, which I wanted to do from our room. Plus we were travelling home on Monday and the weather forecast called for possible snow along our route and I wanted to keep updated on the conditions. 2 of the 3 people we dealt with at the front desk were very courteous and helpful, apologizing for the issues we had. But the one that checked us in and out could really improve her personality. Upon checkout, she even claimed she knew nothing about the internet being a mess all weekend, though I'm pretty sure she was the first one I complained to on Saturday. Another guest said the same thing about her. So, the room was fine, other than the bed size. Property clean. Jacuzzi clean and hot. Just confirm you get the room you reserved, and that the wi-fi is working, if you plan or need to use it for more than a few minutes at a time.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for 8 nights”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: and the only problem we had was with the key cards. Our room, my daughter and I, was right next to the elevator and we never heard it, we did hear people rolling their luggage and talking on the walkway but that was minor, there was also plane noise but since I live close to an air base it didn't bother me. This is an older hotel but very inexpensive, a great feature was the parking under the hotel and a laundry, not so good was the size and age of the towels, etc. There is a gentlemen's club across the street but we heard nothing from them, we were on the backside of the hotel. If the club offends you ask for a room in the back. We didn't use the pool or hot tub, too tired after walking around Sea World, etc. Would I stay there again, you bet. It was close to the public transportation and different venues. We used public transportation alot.

Reviews.Title: “buyer beware!”
Reviews.Author: bpet16
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this very OLD motel was the night clerk. She was very helpful and friendly. She answered all my questions and gave us some restaurant ideas. There is an IHOP right next door, and we did eat there, the food was good. The walkways to our room made me a little nervous with all the changes in flooring height and sponginess. Good thing was an elevator since we were on the top floor. It was slow, but it worked. When we did get to our room, the carpets were in need of cleaning, the bathroom was ancient with a loose toilet seat and only one tiny shampoo - no soap, conditioner, or lotion, and the towels were very old. The air conditioner sounded like a frieght train, and the noise from the airport wasn't too pleasant. Planes constantly, all hours of the day and night. The continental breakfast was a JOKE!!! The coffee sucked! My child did like the pool (at least they had one, not the cleanest), but what does a little kid know about motels? The wi-fi did not even get a good enough signal to connect in my room. A lot of the tv channels had fuzzy reception. And I kinda freaked out when I saw there is a stripclub and a tatoo parlor right across the street, although we did not have any issues with either establishment's patrons. There were alot of families here, only for a quick place to sleep I imagine. For the price we paid (119 + tax) I expect better than a renamed dumpy old motel 6. When I told the day clerk / "manager" about our issues, she did not care one bit! She didn't even try to apologize, but made it sound like our fault re the wi-fi, ac, lack of stock in the bathroom, and the tv. I am planning another trip to this area, but I definately will not ever be back to this shabby shack, not even if they only charged $40 - which would still be overcharging. Clearly, the owners do not really care about thier motel or patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay and will stay there again next time”
Reviews.Author: Jen85051
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints the hotel was close to everything you need. Seaworld was just down the street as well as misson beach and all attractions are fairly close. I enjoyed my stay the room is not huge but is comfortable for sleeping. I appreciate the fact that I needed to check in early as I had my 9month old with me and I had emailed before and I appreciate that they accommodated my request. I was very pleased with my stay and I would definitely stay there again. Thanks to all the staff that made our stay very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for anyone looking for a great deal and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Archive303
Reviews.Content: The room size was adequate and had a fridge, microwave and even a safe. The management was courteous and professional. We have stayed at other locations in San Diego and this is one of the better deals we found. The hotel is a bit older and has some minor repair issues but nothing of great concern or diminshed quality. It was easy to get to sea world, beaches or anywhere in town from this location. This was the best value for that price range in san diego

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good until we left.... :(”
Reviews.Author: pearlrivera
Reviews.Content: I was a guest just a few weeks ago.. we were happy with the room, the surrounding businesses didnt really bother me and the room was clean. There was a shopping center very close and was very convenient. Sea world was really just a few minutes away.....It was quiet at night but we didnt care much for the "breakfast" but I guess it was a good lil bonus.....I had read these reviews prior to my trip and was impressed that the manager Nicole was so involved and i thought that showed how much they really cared about their guests. Well as soon as I got home after we checked out I realized I had left my charger for my Mac Laptop connected underneath the desk in the room. I called right away to ask if they can get it and mail it to me and I even offered to send the postage. Right away i got the feeling of the staff being too busy. I was asked for my name and phone number and was told I would receive a call back right away. 4 hours later I had to call and was told that she lost my number but that she went up there and there was no charger for me to call back when housekeeping came in the next morning. I called and spoke to Barbara and was told to again call back. I did... and nothing.. i called 4 times and i just again called and spoke to Barbara who was clearly in a bad mood and was very short with me on the phone. I told her how is it possible that my charger is not there when you told me that the room has been unoccupied since I checked out? This is a very expensive charger and I know its my fault i forgot it but I would think that your establishment would be a bit more considerate in helping a guest?? I am very dissapointed and Nicole I truly hope you read this and take this seriously. its impossible for the charger to not be there as it was left behind and according to barbara the only ones that have entered the room since is housekeeping??? I dont like to leave bad reviews but in my defense I clearly tried to fix this problem the right way before leaving this review. Nicole I'm asking for your help with this....

Reviews.Title: “Don't let tne name or internet photos fool you!!”
Reviews.Author: Barb1938
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we knew we were in trouble. Even before going into our room we could see that the surrounding area was questionable and the hotel was right across the street from Larry Flint's Hustler club. The room was very small and the carpets were so filthy that the bottoms of my feet were coal black. We complained to the management and all they said was that they clean the carpets once a year. They were NOT apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NurseLovesVacation
Reviews.Content: Even though only 50% of travelers would recommend this hotel, I always find it impressive when the management responds to negative reviews like this hotel does-it shows they care. Anyway, I thought the location was great-very easy access to the freeway system, about 10 minutes from the Zoo, there was an In N Out less than 1 half a mile away, and there was a trolley stop with free parking about 1 mile away. Also, IHOP is right next door, as well as tons of shopping like Ross, TJ Maxx, and restaurants, etc within a 1 mile radius. There was a pool as well as a hot tub-didn't try either. Ice and water just down the outdoor hall. No elevator-didn't bother us. Also, the ac/heating unit is the old type that is either on or off-it can't self regulate. So when we came back after a long day the room was cold. Not a big deal as the heater worked awesome and would heat our room up in a couple minutes. There was breakfast served every morning, but very limited hours (7a-9a). We missed it both mornings. Woke up too late the first morning, the second morning we left too early. That was kind of a bummer-it was one of the reasons I booked this place. There was a micro and well as a decent sized fridge in our room. Also, a desk and chair. Shower/tub combo and good water pressure. Our first night, the area was very quiet-we slept awesome. The next night was NYE, so of course it was pretty loud with the club nearby. But didn't bother me. Also, covered parking was nice and since the hotel is so small, parking is convenient to the room. The front desk lady was very helpful, showing us where the trolley stop is. She was very nice as well. Overall, I am giving the hotel 4 stars. (the hotel states it is a 2 star, and I think that is fair-maybe a 2.5 star). 1/2 star deduction because our room was not serviced by housekeeping at all the 2 nights we were there. Did we call and complain? Nah, didn't care that much. The other 1/2 star deduction is because of the very short breakfast hours. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not a place to go period”
Reviews.Author: BBS20000
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by there web site photos.They advertise a family inn, but this is far from that.I took my 8 yr old to Seaworld,and his first question was "who's Larry Flint?", the name he had read on the strip club across the street from Bay Inn and Suites. My family and I are from the Coachella Valley,and had no idea this place was in that kind of area.That's just the beginning. Very rude and disrespectful staff,Danielle and Barbara. Over priced for a place that looks like hideout for a Bad guy in a 1977 BERRATA episode.NOT A FAMILY PLACE !STOP DECEIVING PEOPLE.It sounded like we were not the first to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Farm Animals Are Not Allowed In the Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: deighter
Reviews.Content: When you look at the first photo of this place, it looks like a nice Spanish style resort with whitewashed walls and a red tile roof. Not true! The place has been repainted a dull tan color, and the entrance is so tiny, you can drive right by it before you see it. The pool is small, lined with cracked concrete, and ice cold -- great if you are a midget who wants to practice swimming in ice water, not so nice for everyone else. You know if you drive from Dallas to Houston on the I35, and in the middle of nowhere, you see a "Motel 11" with rooms for $29 a night, right next to the freeway? And it is a long, two story building, looking like a cheap apartment building? Well.. that's what this place is like, but its jammed into a funky section of San Diego, right near the Marine base and directly across from a topless place. In fairness, the bed was comfortable. It's just that we were disappointed that we were not allowed to bring our llama into the room. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “awesome-clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: XXXYOURSELFXXX
Reviews.Content: odor free, no bugs, room had a safe, full cable and I felt as though my girlfriend and I were completely safe.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MartyPN
Reviews.Content: We were redirected to the Bay Inn and Suites due to a problem with our booking with another hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful and were willing to provide any information on the area. The room was reasonably spacious with two very comfortable queen size beds. The lounge, although small was also adequate. The room was extremely clean. If the hotel we had booked with were not picking up the cost of the accomodation it is doubtful that we would have selected this accommodation due to the exterior appearance and the exotic dancer establishment over the road. In saying this the positive aspects outweighed the doubtful external environment. The only negative aspect we had about the overnight stay was the noise from the neighbouring room when they returned home from a "festive occasion" at approximately 2.30am. The hour long discussion on flatulence problems of George and Vanessa were quite audible. Mind you this poor soundproofing could have happened at any establishment we stayed at. The staff were apologetic and sympathetic the following morning. The place is old and dated in terms of furnishings but more than adequate for a place to sleep if you do not have noisy neighbours. The pool was also good.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised :)”
Reviews.Author: SOCALsrcMOM
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect as my husband made the reservation directly with the hotel. We were planning our trip for a few short days down to San Diego to visit Sea World and the Zoo with the kids. Traveling on a budget (doing everything on a budget these days) we decided to look at a smaller hotel. The Bay Inn and Suites was perfect for our needs. It was close to everything and afforded us a comfortable resting spot between adventures. The pool and hot tub were perfect for the kids. And all of the amenities in the suite we purchased kept my husband and me satisfied (coffee, TV, refrigerator, microwave - we had left overs of course). The staff was very knowlegeable and friendly; the breakfast was a perfect way to get our day started. We were given coupons to use at IHOP and some of the other local restaurants, which we were really happy to use. The hotel met our needs without question or fuss. We were pleasantly surprised with what we found and would certainly return when visiting San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “hated it would not recommed to anyone anytime”
Reviews.Author: JENNYBArizona
Reviews.Content: when I contacted the hotel directly for my reservation I had asked if the hotel was in an safe neighborhood and walking distance to sea world. I was assured the neighborhood was extremely safe and it was less than a mile walk to sea world. Upon arrival I found homeless people digging in the trash cans at the hotel and the Husler club across the street with a parking lot full of loud drunk men. The motel is in need of some major repairs, the walk ways feel like they are going to fall apart and the exterior is in need of some fresh paint. I ask the front desk agent if I could just cancel my reservation and go elsewhere but she said I would still be charged for the entire 3 nights because of the 72 hour cancel policy. With no other choice we checked in to "a deluxe queen" room, I'm not sure what the deluxe stands for, the room was so small we could barely get around the beds. Overall this hotel was nothing like they advertise and the front desk staff was very unfriendly .

Reviews.Title: “Wireless Internet not available in all rooms”
Reviews.Author: businessIowa
Reviews.Content: The past four days, I stayed at Bay Inn and Suites at SeaWorld in San Diego. They advertise "complimentary wireless internet access." Most of the rooms, in fact, do not have a wireless signal that will allow people to hook into the Internet. I had two laptops and wifi phone with me on this trip. None worked from my room on their signal. Walking around with one of the devices trying to find a usable signal, I concluded that about 10% of the rooms probably had a usable signal. When I asked about staying in one of those rooms, the desk clerk told me they were not available. As I was sitting in the lobby, attempting to stay connected with a low, intermittent signal - even in their "best" location - I heard the front desk clerk repeatedly say to other guests on the phone, "It's working." From the rest of the conversation, the subject was ovbviously Internet access. Three other guests came to the small lobby with their laptops when I was there. While there was a local bar advertising free wireless access a block or so away, as one of the other guests put it, "I don't feel comfortable carrying my laptop down there in this neighborhood." I agreed. Management made no attempt to improve the situation or compensate me or others. I recommend people stay away. San Diego, on the other hand, was beautiful. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: Paramedic143
Reviews.Content: This is a standard motel and met our expectations for this type of accommodation. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was average but clean. There is a free breakfast (coffee, juice, danish, muffins). There is a Hustler Club across the street but we didn't find the area sleezy. There were a large number of cheap eats (Pizza Hut, Panda, IHOP, etc) close by. If there at the weekend the local swap meet is across the street as well and we found it cheap. If you want a cheap base to operate from while in San Diego then Its a good budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management”
Reviews.Author: bgttraveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a cheap place to stay, stay at the Bay Inn and Suites, but you get what you pay for. The motel is right across the street from a strip club, the pool is in the parking lot, and the neighborhood appears sketchy. Right from the start we had problems. We called a few days in advance to make sure we could do early check in as our flight got in early in the morning. The motel assured us this would be fine. However, when we arrived, they told us that they had no room available for us and had no record of us calling. Next, we needed a rollaway bed so that an extra person could stay with us unexpectedly. They told us that there would be an extra charge for a rollaway bed, which is ridiculous because we could have just asked to be moved to a room with two queen size beds instead of staying in the room with one king size bed (both rooms are the same price). Instead of asking them to move us, we got the rollaway bed. Upon checking out, I asked for a receipt for the extra charge. The front desk person told us that since we prepaid for our room through AAA, everything had already been taken care of. I assumed that they had comped the rollaway charge since we had already had trouble with the early check in. After I got home, I noticed a charge on my credit card for the price of the rollaway bed AND an additional person fee, which they failed to inform me of. I have been calling the motel for 2 weeks trying to resolve the charges and have still not spoken with a manager. The only positive things I have to say about the Bay Inn and Suites is that it is inexpensive and located near IHOP and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good on Average”
Reviews.Author: uzvizitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for 5 nights in March 2007. Our room was clean but with a moldy/chlorine scent. They could use the new stock of towels, as their existings ones are almost worn out from multi-washes. The wallpaper was kind a old too. Location-is Ok, on a busy Street. It is next to many restaurants and accross from the Exotic Dancer club. However, it did not bother us at all, the club is separate on its own. This motel is close to Seaworld but not in a walking distance. It is about 4-5 min drive on a car accross the Bridge. Also close to highways, and to Old Town San Diego, Mission bay Park/beach. The motel offered continental breakfast could be better than a Muffin and coffee. No cereal, apples, or milk. The good thing, it is right next to IHOP so if you are really a "hot breakfast" person, it is right there. Staff is very friendly, willing to give directions, and about the area information. The reception desk has tickets for area attractions as well. In general, we liked this Motel (not hotel) and it is relatively Good in average. Will stay there again. Thanks!

HotelInfo.Name: Bay Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 3325 Midway Drive, San Diego, CA 92110
